description: Creates a new case rule. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

parameters.name: domainId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of a Cases domain.

parameters.name: rule
parameters.description: Represents what rule type should take place, under what conditions. required (dict) --- Required rule type, used to indicate whether a field is required. List of conditions for the required rule; the first condition to evaluate to true dictates the value of the rule. (dict) --- Boolean condition for a rule. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template. equalTo (dict) --- Tests that operandOne is equal to operandTwo. Represents the left hand operand in the condition. fieldId (string) --- The field ID that this operand should take the value of. Represents the right hand operand in the condition. booleanValue (boolean) --- Boolean value type. doubleValue (float) --- Double value type. emptyValue (dict) --- Empty value type. stringValue (string) --- String value type. The value of the outer rule if the condition evaluates to true. notEqualTo (dict) --- Tests that operandOne is not equal to operandTwo. The value of the rule (that is, whether the field is required) should none of the conditions evaluate to true.

nested_params.name: required
nested_params.description: Required rule type, used to indicate whether a field is required.

nested_params.name: conditions
nested_params.description: List of conditions for the required rule; the first condition to evaluate to true dictates the value of the rule.

nested_params.name: equalTo
nested_params.description: Tests that operandOne is equal to operandTwo.

nested_params.name: operandOne
nested_params.description: Represents the left hand operand in the condition.

nested_params.name: fieldId
nested_params.description: The field ID that this operand should take the value of.

nested_params.name: operandTwo
nested_params.description: Represents the right hand operand in the condition.

nested_params.name: booleanValue
nested_params.description: Boolean value type.

nested_params.name: doubleValue
nested_params.description: Double value type.

nested_params.name: emptyValue
nested_params.description: Empty value type.

nested_params.name: stringValue
nested_params.description: String value type.

nested_params.name: result
nested_params.description: The value of the outer rule if the condition evaluates to true.

nested_params.name: notEqualTo
nested_params.description: Tests that operandOne is not equal to operandTwo.

nested_params.name: operandOne
nested_params.description: Represents the left hand operand in the condition.

nested_params.name: fieldId
nested_params.description: The field ID that this operand should take the value of.

nested_params.name: operandTwo
nested_params.description: Represents the right hand operand in the condition.

nested_params.name: booleanValue
nested_params.description: Boolean value type.

nested_params.name: doubleValue
nested_params.description: Double value type.

nested_params.name: emptyValue
nested_params.description: Empty value type.

nested_params.name: stringValue
nested_params.description: String value type.

nested_params.name: result
nested_params.description: The value of the outer rule if the condition evaluates to true.

nested_params.name: defaultValue
nested_params.description: The value of the rule (that is, whether the field is required) should none of the conditions evaluate to true.

nested_items.name: caseRuleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a case rule.

nested_items.name: caseRuleId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier of a case rule.
